pullRequest.title: Remote validator service
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR Description
This PR introduces a new service in Teku, the Remote Validator service. This service allows remote validators to connect to the beacon node and receive events.
Important parts:

RemoteValidatorService: the actual service class that coordinates the wiring of all components together
RemoteValidatorSubscriptions: the class that maintains the active subscriptions and broadcast events to subscribers
RemoteValidatorApi: the WebSocket service that is used as a channel to publish the messages
RemoteValidatorBeaconChainEventsAdapter: this class listens to all events that a subscriber is interested in.

Fixes #2447
Related Issue(s)
See #1918
Documentation
N/A: this work is in progress

nodes.bodyText: We have a JsonProvider class that would be good to use here instead of creating a new Gson every time.

ah, so this is why we'll wind up merging this into the beacon chain instead of being its own service.  It should be using the same port as the rest of the REST API.  But we may as well delay that until we have a clear direction on what to use for delivering these events.
Yeah ultimately it would have to wind up being a command line option.

nodes.bodyText: We've been consistently not using this in Teku.  Just using the static methods on Mockito rather than the annotations.
And the nice thing about not using @Mock annotations is the values are immediately available so you can just declare these values inline rather than needing a beforeEach method.
